attributes.action: Stop the Government's proposed changes to the Skipton Fund
attributes.background: Prior to July 1992, many people were infected with Hepatitis C due to NHS treatment with infected blood, or before 1987 for blood clotting disorders. Many died and many more are suffering with the pain and misery of this disease, unable to work, adding financial difficulties to their stress.
attributes.additional_details:
The Skipton Fund was set up to provide ex gratia payments to affected patients.

The Government is now consulting on plans to cut these payments.

We must not let this happen; they deserve all the support they are entitled to.

Please sign this petition and pass it on to as many people as possible.

attributes.action: Compulsory prison terms for all drivers speeding to evade a police pursuit
attributes.background: I am horrified by the number of drivers that speed recklessly, particularly through residential areas, threatening the lives of pedestrians and other road users, in order to evade pursuing police. When eventually caught, they rarely receive a custodial sentence, despite posing such a danger to life.

attributes.action: Make the public aware of the dangers of Ibuprofen in children with Chickenpox
attributes.background: A UK newspaper reported a case of parents being advised to taken a brand of medication containing Ibuprofen for chickenpox, causing severe complications (septicemia) Patient UK,NHS Choices,NICE warns of a potential reaction during chickenpox,public need to be aware & medications need to highlight it
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/659299/Nurofen-chickenpox-ibuprofen-septicaemia-parents-danger-medicine-skin-rash

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Chickenpox/Pages/Treatment.aspx

http://cks.nice.org.uk/chickenpox#!prescribinginfosub:1

http://patient.info/health/chickenpox-in-children-under-12

attributes.action: Support equal access to education for children in Africa.
attributes.background: Reports suggest that 70 million children get no education across the world and those living in north-eastern Africa are least likely to go to school. By raising awareness on the issue on a national scale we can help those children who are disadvantaged by supporting their journey through education.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/education/2010/sep/20/70m-get-no-education

An education would lead to a good career, build character and construct the foundations for a strong nation, which is further suggested by humanitarian Nelson Mandela; “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” If you teach a child how to read and write, it will allow them to be empowered with knowledge which will be crucial to give them a better future and the impacts to be sustained.

attributes.action: More research into Medullary Sponge Kidney disease (MSK)
attributes.background: I am in the MSK patients I live with daily pain upon researching this illness there is not much research we have chronic pain and many other daily problems there isn't many doctors that understand this illness and living with this is a nightmare you get labelled as drug users this is wrong
attributes.additional_details: I found a group on Facebook this seems to be a worldwide problem not many doctors understand this disease and I think there should be more research into what could help us live a normal life it doesn't just affect those patients it affects everyone around us and I think there should be more research into what could help us live a normal life we shouldn't have to endor there ignorance towards this illness please can we have the help we need to live a half normal life

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Change the process through which referendums are held
attributes.background: The entire electorate to be given an automatic vote in favour of the status quo. Only those wishing to change the status quo should be required to register an alternative vote.
attributes.additional_details: In this way if 51% + of the electorate is motivated to get out and vote a clear mandate for change is demonstrated. Anything else is undemocratic and simply counts those motivated to actively vote, even when they didn't ask for any change to begin with. Only those opposed to majority rule would be against this.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in Nicky Morgan, Education Secretary
attributes.background: Nicky Morgan has recently introduced plans for every school in England to become an academy. State schools are regulated by parents and local authorities, wheras academies set their own curriculum, staff conditions and are run by a private sponsor.

attributes.action: Move the clock change day to a Thursday.
attributes.background: Move the clock change day to a Thursday so people can still have a lie in and enjoy their weekend as nobody is really bothered about losing an hours sleep before a Friday.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Start to plan real strategy to deal with Donald Trump as President.
attributes.background: The USA could well be run by Donald Trump in 2017, he, his policies and his supporters are the biggest threat to democracy & world security in the 21st century. We must start planning for this possible outcome and distance ourselves from the United States of America.
attributes.additional_details:
Should Trump become President we should...

Stop buying US:
Weapons;
Goods;
Services; &
Oil (crude)

Remove:
US ran military bases in the UK and vote to remove them across the EU; &
Agreements to use UK airspace / airfields for US military (airforce, army, navy, et al)

Veto:
All US led UN war resolutions; &
All UN tabled resolutions that could result in an outbreak of war or invasion by the US or UN.

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Require 30% of all restaurant tips to go towards chefs
attributes.background: The chefs work as hard or maybe even more so it is only fair they get some of the tips. Seeing as most chefs earn a bit less than waiters in most places and work twice as hard at most times.
attributes.additional_details: I have worked in many kitchens where no tips have been cut and have always been unfair and so do many people. I now work in a place where the tips get cut by 40% so that the kitchen has a little extra in their pocket, and it works so great and gives us an extra goal to work towards.

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Require by law Landlords/Ladies to change mattresses between different tenants.
attributes.background: Hi. I'm just another student in the London renting market. Yep, that open sewer of real estate. Thanks to not being provided a new mattress when I moved in to a property, I have had both fleas and bedbugs. I am asking that the government require new mattresses for new tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
When I moved into a property two years ago my mattress had been left in the shed for a "few" days whilst work was done on my room. Instead of receiving a new mattress I got the old one from the previous tenant, plus some new friends - fleas! 
This year, I moved into a property and discovered the old mattress was infested with bed bugs! Thanks previous tenant! 
Whilst it may be expensive to replace mattresses, no tenant should have to live through bug infestations.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Make teachers do inset day training in school holidays
attributes.background: School Inset days drastically effect working families and all training should be done during school holidays so as not to effect families daily routines as well as the pupils everyday learning
attributes.additional_details: Teachers set inset days usually just after school restarts from school holidays so why can they not do them during the free 13 weeks they have each year

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Allow workers to continue to sacrifice their salaries in exchange for safer cars
attributes.background: The Daily Mail have reported today that "The Treasury’s proposed rules could come into force next April and would effectively kill off tax benefits worth thousands of pounds a year for company car drivers. Under the plans, workers would be taxed . . ."
attributes.additional_details: Salary sacrifice schemes are the only way some people would ever be able to drive a nice car - you see far fewer "old bangers" on the road nowadays. These schemes must be hugely beneficial to car manufacturers and all associated industries.

attributes.action: Get Saddleworth Back Into West riding of Yorkshire; Separate From Oldham!
attributes.background: In 1866 saddleworth became a civil parish in its own right and in 1889 became part of the administrative county of the West Riding of Yorkshire. In 1894 the parish's boundaries were altered with the parts in Quickmere Middle Division (Springhead), Mossley and Uppermill becoming Urban Districts.
attributes.additional_details: The residue became a single-parish rural district. Unfortunately in 1996 the boundaries were changed for the worst & Saddleworth became a part of Oldham, this needs to be reverted back! we should be our own district again belonging to west Yorkshire. please sign this petition to get our boundaries changed back!

attributes.action: Ask the Government to issue a medal to the wounded military serving personnel.
attributes.background: Unlike the United States who issue the Purple Heart Medal, the British Armed Services do not recognize the sacrifices made by those who serve and are wounded or killed during their service by way of a special medal. We believe it is shameful that such a medal does not exist and needs to be rectified
attributes.additional_details: We ask the British Government to create a special medal to be awarded to servicemen and servicewomen who, while serving under competent authority in any capacity with one of the UK Armed Forces has been wounded or killed. We also ask that the Government consider that this medal be posthumously awarded to qualifying servicemen and servicewomen who have been wounded or killed since the 28th July 1914.

attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Stop NHS denying help for eating disorders on grounds patients are "too complex"
attributes.background: As someone who personally suffers from an eating disorder, I have been lucky to receive adequate treatment to recover. However, for a number of people who suffer and want to recover, particularly those who need admitting as an inpatient, some are told they are "too complex" for treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Due to lack of mental health beds, and NICE guidelines stipulating special requirements for the treatment of eating disorders, some patients are being told they are "too complex" to receive treatment at the present time, even though they are willing to recover in an inpatient setting. Due to the guidelines and shortage of beds, those with eating disorders are slipping through the cracks of the system, and this is allowing for needless deaths that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Remove the charge for calling 101 non police emergency.
attributes.background: We shouldn't be charged 15 pence for calling 101, when calling 999 is free.

attributes.action: Remove the Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.

attributes.action: Stop foreign workers taking British jobs in culturally important industries
attributes.background: We petition the Government to apply any immigration controls implemented Post Brexit to all industries, even culturally important ones, with very few exceptions even if the company or foreigner is extremely rich. Especially where there are young British people eager to do the jobs with the skills
attributes.additional_details: This must be applied to all, particularly to Sports clubs and especially football. The only exception should be that each club is allowed 1 coach & 1 player to be non Brit. The invasion of football with foreigners is hurting the ability of young Brits to develop & gain experience, this is hurting the national team. There are 100's of talented young Brits who could fill these roles so foreigners aren't required. Culturally significant industries are Sport, Media and Show business.

attributes.action: Make ALL schools teach kids the dangers of the railway.
attributes.background:
We all know that the railway is a dangerous place, however people still do not understand this and are running across the tracks at stations, laying on the tracks or even playing chicken at level crossings.

Last year 332 people died after trespassing onto the railway tracks in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Now kids think it's right to play on the railway and ignore all the safety rules displayed around the tracks. 

If schools teach kids that it's dangerous to play on or around the railway then the figures might go down and there will be less deaths.

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: A government review into the feasibility of driverless trains within the UK
attributes.background: We request a government led industry review, working with all train operators/ management and unions into the feasibility of driverless trains in the UK. The current approach where millions of the population are constrained by the availability of train drivers (sickness or strike) is not acceptable
attributes.additional_details:
Driverless technology is being adopted across the car industry (e.g. Google, Nissan and Tesla). This technology on complex, multi vehicle transport routes. 
https://www.cbinsights.com/blog/autonomous-driverless-vehicles-corporations-list/

attributes.action: Introduce motorcycle licence progression training as per the 3rd EU Directive.
attributes.background: Department of Transport ignored the licence progression training in Article 7.1.c of 3rd EU Driving Licence Directive. It imposed compulsory retesting which removed all incentive for novices to train and qualify for A1. There was an 8% increase in Killed & Seriously Injured 'after' implementation.
attributes.additional_details: 17-19 year olds can ride A1 class bikes (125cc) on a CBT cert. At 19 they can take the A2 test for larger bikes. There is now no incentive to train to A1 test standard because they are forced to repeat the same tests when they are entitled to progress at 19. This essentially entices them to wait and continue on a CBT. They ride for up to 2 years without any highway code knowledge, theory test and hazard perception. CBT only gives them 2 hours road preparation. DVSA stats show a 8% KSI increase.

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Reform of the UK's honours system, reflecting achievement, not money donated.
attributes.background:
The honours system has become discredited to the point that highest bidders win high honours, irrespective of their achievements and merit to the country.

Honours should only be given for real, tangible, honourable acts or achievements - not for political donations or doing a Whitehall job.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems incredulous that people are given knighthoods for doing Whitehall jobs they have been handsomely paid for anyway, yet doctors, nurses, consultants, teachers, firefighters, police etc all struggle to get recognition for saving lives and transforming society.

Handing honours to people who have helped individuals achieve office by money or political manoeuvring is sheer cronyism; the current system must now be overhauled to stop its dishonourable use and restore its proper status.

attributes.action: Make a UK-wide ban on the use of artifical colourings in medication.
attributes.background:
Artifical colouring agents are often unnecessarily used in medication to effect a particular appearance rather than for any significant gain or change in the effectiveness of medications. 
As one of many people prone to allergic reactions to colourings E102-E133 I request a ban from medication use.
attributes.additional_details:
Artifical colourings can make it greatly difficult for those sensetive to find even basic medication without adverse effects.  Examples of which are calcium supplements containing brilliant blue E133 and antibiotics such as amoxicillin containing sunset yellow E110

Reactions in those allergic can range from migraines and photosensitivity,  hypersensitivity,  vomiting & in my personal experience with E133 rash,  nausea, swelling of throat and disorientation. These are unacceptable & unnecessary

attributes.action: Drivers over 60 to take a mini driving test
attributes.background: Drivers over the age of 60 to take a mini test, due to them having slow reaction times .
attributes.additional_details: As we age, we slow down. I think that drivers over the age of 60 should have to take a mini test. There are way to many old drivers causing accidents due to due care and attention.A mini test every five years would lesson the amount of accidents caused by people over 60.
